body:
Thanks for the feedback! If your issue is related to the Flutter framework itself, please open an issue at [github.com/flutter/flutter](https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/new). ### Issue Type: Bug. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Open a flutter project in VS Code. 2. Open the Command Pallet( Control+Shift+P). 3. Select Flutter: Select Device. 4. Create an Android Emulator from Android AVD images(if haven't already). 5. Choose an Android emulator. 6. Wait till the emulator starts. 7. The emulator cannot be minimized. ### Even if I start the emulator with **flutter emulators --launch flutter_emulator** Proof: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79036875/180995750-ebfc8023-063e-4aba-b3a4-90a2ff07d676.mp4 ### Even if I try to do it with cmd then also the problem persists: 1. Run flutter config --machine. 2. Find android-sdk path. 3. Run /home/shlok/Android/Sdk/emulator/emulator -avd flutter_emulator but replace /home/shlok/Android/Sdk/ with the android-sdk path and flutter_emulator with the emulator name. ## What I expected to happen: 1. Emulator should minimize when pressing the minimize button. ## What actually happens: 1. The emulator minimizes and opens automatically although it should have been minimized. ## Proof: https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79036875/180995369-74a823de-2787-4c33-8439-85f159eb7ab6.mp4 System Info |Item|Value| |---|---| |CPUs|AMD Ryzen 5 3550H with Radeon Vega Mobile Gfx (8 x 1400)| |GPU Status|2d_canvas: enabled
canvas_oop_rasterization: disabled_off
direct_rendering_display_compositor: disabled_off_ok
gpu_compositing: enabled
multiple_raster_threads: enabled_on
opengl: enabled_on
rasterization: enabled
raw_draw: disabled_off_ok
skia_renderer: enabled_on
video_decode: disabled_software
video_encode: disabled_software
vulkan: disabled_off
webgl: enabled
webgl2: enabled| |Load (avg)|2, 1, 1| |Memory (System)|5.73GB (0.12GB free)| |Process Argv|--no-sandbox . --crash-reporter-id ac2a9ee4-7023-4d78-be8f-230bafddad07| |Screen Reader|no| |VM|0%| |DESKTOP_SESSION|ubuntu| |XDG_CURRENT_DESKTOP|Unity| |XDG_SESSION_DESKTOP|ubuntu| |XDG_SESSION_TYPE|x11|
A/B Experiments ``` vsliv368cf:30146710 vsreu685:30147344 python383cf:30185419 vspor879:30202332 vspor708:30202333 vspor363:30204092 vswsl492:30256859 vslsvsres303:30308271 pythonvspyl392:30443607 vserr242:30382549 pythontb:30283811 vsjup518:30340749 pythonvspyt551cf:30345471 pythonptprofiler:30281270 vshan820:30294714 vstes263:30335439 vscorecescf:30445987 pythondataviewer:30285071 vscod805:30301674 binariesv615:30325510 bridge0708:30335490 bridge0723:30353136 cmake_vspar411:30525688 vsaa593cf:30376535 vsc1dst:30438360 pythonvs932:30410667 wslgetstarted:30449410 vscscmwlcmt:30465135 cppdebug:30492333 pylanb8912:30529769 vsclangdf:30486550 841h4636:30532337 ```
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79036875/180786514-07770184-eed9-4556-886b-dff280ebda33.mp4 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79036875/180784347-ace407c5-2ce2-40ad-a896-6b92d1bf0538.png) ## Version info Please paste the output of running `flutter doctor -v` here (available from the command line or from `Tools > Flutter > Flutter Doctor`). It will provide the version of the Flutter framework as well as of the IntelliJ plugin. â¯ flutter doctor -v [âœ“] Flutter (Channel beta, 3.3.0-0.0.pre, on Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS 5.15.0-41-generic, locale en_IN) â€¢ Flutter version 3.3.0-0.0.pre on channel beta at /home/shlok/snap/flutter/common/flutter â€¢ Upstream repository https://github.com/flutter/flutter.git â€¢ Framework revision f90da9b167 (7 days ago), 2022-07-18 18:59:23 -0700 â€¢ Engine revision 1388adb442 â€¢ Dart version 2.18.0 (build 2.18.0-271.2.beta) â€¢ DevTools version 2.15.0 [âœ“] Android toolchain - develop for Android devices (Android SDK version 32.1.0-rc1) â€¢ Android SDK at /home/shlok/Android/Sdk â€¢ Platform android-32, build-tools 32.1.0-rc1 â€¢ Java binary at: /snap/android-studio/current/android-studio/jre/bin/java â€¢ Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.12+0-b1504.28-7817840) â€¢ All Android licenses accepted. [âœ—] Chrome - develop for the web (Cannot find Chrome executable at google-chrome) ! Cannot find Chrome. Try setting CHROME_EXECUTABLE to a Chrome executable. [âœ“] Linux toolchain - develop for Linux desktop â€¢ clang version 6.0.0-1ubuntu2 (tags/RELEASE_600/final) â€¢ cmake version 3.10.2 â€¢ ninja version 1.8.2 â€¢ pkg-config version 0.29.1 [âœ“] Android Studio (version 2021.2) â€¢ Android Studio at /snap/android-studio/123/android-studio â€¢ Flutter plugin can be installed from: ðŸ”¨ https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/9212-flutter â€¢ Dart plugin can be installed from: ðŸ”¨ https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/6351-dart â€¢ Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.12+0-b1504.28-7817840) [âœ“] Android Studio â€¢ Android Studio at /snap/android-studio/current/android-studio â€¢ Flutter plugin can be installed from: ðŸ”¨ https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/9212-flutter â€¢ Dart plugin can be installed from: ðŸ”¨ https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/6351-dart â€¢ android-studio-dir = /snap/android-studio/current/android-studio â€¢ Java version OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 11.0.12+0-b1504.28-7817840) [âœ“] VS Code â€¢ VS Code at /snap/code/current â€¢ Flutter extension version 3.44.0 [âœ“] Connected device (2 available) â€¢ Pixel (mobile) â€¢ 1e7242fc â€¢ android-arm64 â€¢ Android 11 (API 30) â€¢ Linux (desktop) â€¢ linux â€¢ linux-x64 â€¢ Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS 5.15.0-41-generic [âœ“] HTTP Host Availability â€¢ All required HTTP hosts are available ! comment_data.body: I appreciate the detailed report. Unfortunately, I don't think this is the best place to report it. It looks like a problem with the emulator. Have you tried using Android Studio to launch the emulator? If it won't minimize in that config, then you should report a problem to the Android Studio team. If it does minimize, then I think the problem should be reported to the Flutter framework team, since launching from the Flutter tool causes it to not minimize.

It doesn't minimize and it was them who referred you to me (
https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/240102039).

On Tue, 26 Jul 2022 at 20:58, stevemessick ***@***.***> wrote:

> I appreciate the detailed report. Unfortunately, I don't think this is the
> best place to report it. It looks like a problem with the emulator. Have
> you tried using Android Studio to launch the emulator? If it won't minimize
> in that config, then you should report a problem to the Android Studio
> team. If it does minimize, then I think the problem should be reported to
> the Flutter framework team, since launching from the Flutter tool causes it
> to not minimize.
>
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/issues/6272#issuecomment-1195631765>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AS3ADS2EBMDCSNTP2ITDN2TVV77YPANCNFSM54VSWT3A>
> .
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>

I see. What you need to do is file a new issue with Android Studio and be sure to _not_ mention Flutter. Ideally, include a video of launching the emulator from Android Studio and trying to minimize the emulator window. That will make it clear that the problem is entirely with Android Studio.

title: Android emulator would not minimize.
